security: This dispatch reveals the names and potential allegiances of Cuban medical personnel, which, if exposed, could endanger individuals mentioned and compromise ongoing intelligence operations. Also, the details regarding ransom cases, and possible involvement of BUSTAMANTE O'Leary, could provide information about intelligence gathering methods and potentially expose sources and methods. Directly quoting 'the Frusted headshrinker of the regime, then this report may indicate that ho is cooperating, with or without regime knowledge, in obtaining the release of certain political prisoners.' This statement reveals the sensitivity of the operations and the need to protect those involved.
summary: Two dispatches from April and May 1970 detail debriefing information from a Cuban refugee, Dr. Mario Enrique Eugenio Martinez Delgado, regarding Cuban medical personalities and a potential ransom case involving Cuban political prisoners and Dr. Jose Bustamante O'Leary.
summary_one_paragraph: These dispatches, originating from the Western Hemisphere Division and WH/Miami, summarize information obtained from the debriefing of Cuban refugee Dr. Mario Enrique Eugenio Martinez Delgado, focusing on Cuban medical personnel both pro- and anti-Castro. The first dispatch details the backgrounds and political leanings of several doctors including Jose Angel Bustamante O'Leary, Armando De Cordova, Edmundo Gutierrez Agramonte, Ruben Mignagaray, and Lino Bernabe Fernandez Martinez, as well as information on Vicky Andrial and Iliana Arango. The second dispatch discusses a potential ransom case involving a Dr. Molina from Chicago and Bustamante O'Learyâ€™s possible involvement in assisting Cuban political prisoners in La Cabana.
title: Debriefing of CC-4276 and Cuban Doctor Possibly Involved with Ransom Cases
recipient: Chief, Western Hemisphere Division; Chief, European Division; Chief of Station, WH/Miami; Chief of Station, Madrid; DO Base/Chicago
